c-0: ^We just had the craziest gig so far. We had it in a barn, which I thought was gonna be nicer, but it was littered with hay and other random stuff.
^Despite that, it was an amazing place.
c-1: ^I know last time we talked I was unsure of how it was gonna go with the band. I'm happy to say now that I worried about it for nothing.
c-2: ^Actually, I don't really feel like talking right now. Sorry.
^No need to apologize, we all have those moments.

C1: ^Sounds like it would be a nightmare to play in. With all the hay getting in your fur, and the smell of a barn, you know?

c-0: ^Well once you get used to it, it isn't actually that bad. With all the people there, it kinda masked the barn smell too.
^Although I do think I still have some hay stuck in my fur, so maybe that's the biggest issue.
^Yeah, you're probably gonna be brushing that out for a few more days at least.
c-1: ^Yeah, it got bad a few times. Mainly at start and end because we were the first there and the last to leave, so we dealt with it the most.
^That's band life for you, especially as a smaller one. You need to set up and tear down your own gear.
^Once you're more popular, you might be able to hire people to do that for you.

C2: ^That's great to hear kiddo! What do you think did it?

c-0: ^Honestly, I think it was just giving them a bit of time to adjust to me being there with them.
^It's not like they were totally against me working with them, or else they wouldn't have wanted me to help in the first place.
^See, I told you it would work out if you had a bit of patience.
c-1: ^Sounds kinda egotistical to say, but I think it was thanks to how well I've been doing and how fast I can adapt to changes?
^They've really been liking that from me, so maybe that's all it took.
^If they liked what you were doing, then that's for sure a huge plus.
